items.label: 1942 (Elite Systems)
items.platforms: Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, NES, Arcade
items.desc: 1942 is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up made by Capcom that was released for the arcade in 1984. It was the first game in the 19XX series. It was followed by 1943: The Battle of Midway.

items.label: 3D Grand Prix (Amsoft)
items.desc: Players take control of a Formula One car and race across a variety of tracks. The game features a 3D perspective that was innovative for its time, delivering a sense of speed and realism previously unseen in 8-bit racing games. The gameplay includes time trials, qualifying laps, and full races, offering a challenging experience for players.

items.label: Airwolf (Elite Systems - Amsoft)
items.platforms: Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, BBC Micro, Commodore 16, Plus/4
items.desc: The game puts players in control of the Airwolf helicopter, piloted by Stringfellow Hawke. The objective is to navigate through enemy-filled environments, rescue hostages, and complete missions inspired by the TV series. The gameplay focuses on precision flying, shooting enemies, and avoiding obstacles.

items.label: Jet Set Willy (Software Projects)
items.platforms: ZX Spectrum, Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, BBC Micro, and others.
items.desc: Players take on the role of Miner Willy, a character tasked with cleaning up his sprawling mansion after a massive party. The game features a non-linear structure, allowing players to explore a vast network of interconnected rooms, each filled with traps, enemies, and platforming challenges. To complete the game, players must collect all the scattered items across the mansion before being allowed to sleep.

items.label: Dead Or Alive ++ (Japan)
items.desc: Dead or Alive++ features improvements over the original game, including rebalanced gameplay, new modes, and enhanced graphics. The game introduced a training mode and additional moves for the characters, making it a more refined and competitive experience. It retains the series’ hallmark mechanics, such as the counter system and fast-paced, fluid combat.

items.label: Dragonball Z 2 - Super Battle
items.desc: Once again Goku returns in his search for the Dragon Balls! Help him to defeat all his adversaries with new movements and fantastic characters. Fight until your strength is exhausted and prove that you are the most powerful warrior! Good luck...

items.label: Fatal Fury 3 - Road to the Final Victory
items.platforms: Neo Geo (arcade and home console), Neo Geo CD, Sega Saturn, PlayStation, and others.
items.desc: The game builds upon its predecessors by introducing new gameplay mechanics, enhanced graphics, and a more complex storyline. The narrative follows the continuing saga of Terry and Andy Bogard, Joe Higashi, and a new roster of characters as they confront the mysterious Jin brothers while searching for the ancient Scrolls of Immortality.

items.label: Mortal Kombat 3 (rev 2.1)
items.desc: Mortal Kombat is a revolutionary fighting game series featuring brutal combat mechanics and iconic fatalities.

items.label: Samurai Shodown / Samurai Spirits (NGH-045)
items.platforms: Neo Geo, Sega Saturn, PlayStation, Arcade
items.desc: Samurai Shodown is a weapon-based fighting game set in feudal Japan, known for its strategic combat and diverse characters.

items.label: Samurai Shodown III / Samurai Spirits - Zankurou Musouken (NGH-087)
items.platforms: Neo Geo, Sega Saturn, PlayStation, Arcade
items.desc: Samurai Shodown is a weapon-based fighting game set in feudal Japan, known for its strategic combat and diverse characters.

items.label: Samurai Shodown IV - Amakusa's Revenge / Samurai Spirits - Amakusa Kourin
items.platforms: Neo Geo, Sega Saturn, PlayStation, Arcade
items.desc: Samurai Shodown is a weapon-based fighting game set in feudal Japan, known for its strategic combat and diverse characters.

items.label: Samurai Shodown V Special / Samurai Spirits Zero Special (NGM-2720)
items.platforms: Neo Geo, Sega Saturn, PlayStation, Arcade
items.desc: Samurai Shodown is a weapon-based fighting game set in feudal Japan, known for its strategic combat and diverse characters.

items.label: Soul Calibur (World, SOC14/VER.C)
items.desc: Set in a fantastical version of the 16th century, Soul Calibur follows the story of warriors seeking the legendary Soul Edge, a powerful yet cursed weapon. The game combines fluid combat, a diverse cast of characters, and stunning visuals to create an immersive fighting experience.

items.label: Soul Edge Ver. II (World, SO4/VER.C)
items.desc: Set in a fictional 16th-century world, the game tells the story of warriors from various backgrounds who seek the mythical Soul Edge, a legendary blade that grants immense power but is cursed. The game’s narrative unfolds through the unique motivations and backstories of its diverse roster of characters.

items.label: Street Fighter (US, set 1)
items.desc: Street Fighter is a legendary fighting game series featuring one-on-one combat between diverse martial artists.

items.label: Street Fighter EX Plus (USA 970407)
items.desc: Street Fighter is a legendary fighting game series featuring one-on-one combat between diverse martial artists.

items.label: Street Fighter III: New Generation (Asia 970204, NO CD, bios set 1)
items.desc: Street Fighter is a legendary fighting game series featuring one-on-one combat between diverse martial artists.

items.label: Super Street Fighter II X: Grand Master Challenge (Japan 940223)
items.desc: Street Fighter is a legendary fighting game series featuring one-on-one combat between diverse martial artists.

items.label: Tekken (World, TE4/VER.C)
items.desc: Set in the context of the King of Iron Fist Tournament, players take on the role of one of eight fighters competing for glory, each with their unique backstories and fighting styles. The game features a mix of traditional martial arts and innovative 3D combat mechanics.

items.label: Tekken 4 (USA)
items.desc: The story revolves around the King of Iron Fist Tournament 4, organized by the Mishima Zaibatsu. Players follow characters old and new as they vie for control over the powerful organization. The narrative centers around family rivalries, betrayal, and redemption, with Kazuya Mishima returning after being presumed dead.

items.label: The Last Blade 2 (known in Japan as Bakumatsu Roman: Dai Ni Maku Gekka no Kenshi)
items.platforms: Neo Geo (arcade and home console), Dreamcast, PlayStation, and PC.
items.desc: Set in the late Edo period of Japan, the game revolves around a mystical portal called “Hell’s Gate.” Players control one of several characters with unique weapon-based fighting styles as they engage in battles influenced by the supernatural storyline.

items.label: X-Men Vs. Street Fighter (Euro 961004)
items.desc: The game introduces a tag-team mechanic where players select two characters to battle against their opponent’s team. Players can swap characters during a match, allowing for dynamic strategies and combos. The game’s vibrant art style, fast-paced gameplay, and roster of fan-favorite characters made it a hit in arcades.

items.label: Aero Fighters Special (Taiwan)
items.desc: Players choose from a roster of pilots, each with their own unique aircraft and weaponry. The game involves navigating through waves of enemies, dodging bullet patterns, and defeating massive bosses. Its vibrant graphics, intense action, and cooperative gameplay make it a standout in the shoot-’em-up genre.

items.label: Raiden Fighters Jet (US)
items.platforms: Arcade (Seibu SPI System), later ported to Xbox 360 (Raiden Fighters Aces).
items.desc: Set in a futuristic battlefield, players pilot advanced aircraft to take on waves of enemies and massive bosses. Raiden Fighters Jet refines the gameplay of the series with the addition of branching stages, improved scoring systems, and dynamic enemy patterns.

items.label: 1942 (First Version)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, PC.
items.desc: Set in the Pacific Theater of World War II, 1942 tasks players with shooting down enemy planes and avoiding obstacles while collecting power-ups. The ultimate goal is to reach Tokyo and destroy the Japanese air fleet. The game’s simple mechanics and addictive gameplay made it a hit in arcades.

items.label: 1945k III
items.desc: Set in an alternate World War II universe, 1945k III tasks players with piloting advanced planes to defeat waves of enemies and colossal bosses. The game retains the arcade-style aesthetic and gameplay mechanics of its predecessors while introducing new planes, weapons, and levels.

items.label: Gunbird 2
items.platforms: Arcade, Dreamcast, PlayStation 2, Nintendo Switch, PC.
items.desc: Set in a fantasy world, Gunbird 2 follows a diverse cast of characters, each with unique backstories and motivations, as they search for the elusive elements needed to grant a magical wish. The game is known for its colorful graphics, fast-paced action, and quirky humor.

items.label: Raiden (set 1)
items.platforms: Arcade, MS-DOS, Sega Genesis, Super Nintendo, PlayStation, and more.
items.desc: Players pilot the Raiden Supersonic Attack Fighter to battle against alien forces invading Earth. Set across eight stages, the game features intense enemy waves, massive bosses, and a signature power-up system that rewards skillful play.

items.label: Strikers 1945 II
items.platforms: Arcade, PlayStation, Sega Saturn, Neo Geo, Nintendo Switch, PC.
items.desc: Players pilot advanced, customizable aircraft to battle enemy forces in an alternate history version of World War II. The game introduces fast-paced gameplay, diverse planes, and unique weapon systems, all while maintaining the challenging difficulty that Psikyo is known for.

items.label: 1944: The Loop Master (USA 000620)
items.desc: Set during World War II, the game tasks players with piloting advanced fighter planes to battle enemy forces across challenging stages. Featuring vibrant visuals, dynamic enemy formations, and explosive boss battles, 1944: The Loop Master retains the essence of classic arcade shoot-’em-ups while introducing new gameplay elements.

items.label: Aero Fighters 3 / Sonic Wings 3
items.desc: A classic video game. Details about gameplay and storyline are not currently available.

items.label: Aero Fighters 2 / Sonic Wings 2
items.desc: Set in a war-torn world, Aero Fighters 2 tasks players with piloting advanced aircraft to combat waves of enemies and powerful bosses. Known for its humor and diverse characters, the game balances intense arcade action with lighthearted storytelling elements.

items.label: After Burner
items.platforms: Arcade, Sega Master System, Sega Genesis, PC Engine, and various modern platforms.
items.desc: Set in a high-stakes, fast-paced aerial battlefield, After Burner challenges players to take down waves of enemy fighters while avoiding incoming missiles. The game is notable for its innovative use of scaling and sprite rotation, creating an immersive and exhilarating sense of speed.

items.label: After Burner II
items.platforms: Arcade, Sega Genesis, Sega Master System, PC Engine, and various modern platforms.
items.desc: Players pilot an F-14 Tomcat fighter jet, battling waves of enemy aircraft while navigating dynamic environments. After Burner II introduced minor gameplay improvements, additional stages, and new features, such as throttle control, enhancing the overall experience.

items.label: Arkanoid (US)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Atari ST, Amiga, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, and modern platforms.
items.desc: Players control the Vaus, a paddle-like spaceship tasked with destroying blocks by bouncing a ball (energy bolt) off of it. The game features multiple levels, each with unique layouts, and introduces power-ups that add variety and strategy to the gameplay. The goal is to destroy all the blocks in each level while preventing the ball from falling out of bounds.

items.label: Asterix (ver EAD)
items.desc: Set in ancient Gaul, players embark on a journey to rescue kidnapped villagers and defeat the Roman Empire. The game features vibrant visuals, humor inspired by the original comics, and cooperative gameplay that lets two players team up as Asterix and Obelix.

items.label: Bomb Jack (set 1)
items.platforms: Arcade, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, and other home systems.
items.desc: Players control Jack, a superhero tasked with collecting bombs scattered across various iconic landmarks. The goal is to collect all bombs in each level while avoiding enemies and traps. Collecting bombs in a specific sequence increases the score, adding a strategic element to the fast-paced action.

items.label: Bomber Man World / New Dyna Blaster - Global Quest
items.desc: In Bomber Man World, players travel across different regions of the world, placing bombs to destroy enemies and obstacles while searching for power-ups. The game introduces new environments, enemies, and power-ups, adding variety to the classic Bomberman formula. The goal is to clear levels by strategically placing bombs to defeat all enemies or fulfill specific objectives.

items.label: Bubble Bobble (US, Ver 5.1)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amiga, and many modern platforms.
items.desc: A classic video game. Details about gameplay and storyline are not currently available.

items.label: Cabal (Alpha Trading)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amiga, PC.
items.desc: Players assume the role of a commando on a mission to destroy enemy bases. The gameplay revolves around using a stationary soldier to shoot down waves of enemies, destroy structures, and avoid incoming fire. Each stage ends with a final wave or a large enemy vehicle, such as tanks or helicopters.

items.label: Commando (World)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amiga, PC, and modern collections.
items.desc: Players control a lone soldier named Super Joe who is on a mission to infiltrate enemy territory, rescue hostages, and defeat waves of enemy soldiers. Armed with a machine gun and grenades, players navigate through multiple levels, each culminating in a climactic battle.

items.label: Contra (US, set 1)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, MSX2, PC, and modern collections.
items.desc: Set in the year 2633, Contra follows two elite commandos, Bill Rizer and Lance Bean, as they fight to stop an alien invasion orchestrated by the Red Falcon organization. Armed with powerful weapons, the duo navigates through hostile environments filled with waves of enemies, environmental hazards, and deadly bosses.

items.label: Donkey Kong (US set 2)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Atari 2600, Intellivision, ColecoVision, PC, and modern collections.
items.desc: In Donkey Kong, players control Jumpman, who must rescue Pauline from the titular ape, Donkey Kong. The game features four unique stages, each with escalating difficulty and different hazards, including barrels, fireballs, and collapsing platforms.

items.label: Double Dragon (Neo-Geo)
items.platforms: Neo-Geo (arcade and home console), PlayStation, Sega Saturn.
items.desc: Set in a post-apocalyptic world, Double Dragon pits players against each other in a martial arts tournament to decide the fate of the “Double Dragon” medallion. The game retains the spirit of the series with iconic characters like Billy and Jimmy Lee, alongside new fighters, while adopting mechanics akin to popular fighting games of the era.

items.label: Double Dragon II - The Revenge (US)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Sega Mega Drive/Genesis, Amiga, ZX Spectrum, Commodore 64, PC.
items.desc: After Marian, the brothers’ companion, is killed by the Shadow Warriors gang, Billy and Jimmy set out for revenge. The game features refined combat mechanics, new moves, and challenging stages filled with waves of enemies and environmental hazards.

items.label: Final Fight (World, set 1)
items.platforms: Arcade, SNES, Sega CD, Commodore 64, Amiga, and modern platforms.
items.desc: A classic video game. Details about gameplay and storyline are not currently available.

items.label: From TV Animation Slam Dunk - Super Slams
items.desc: Players choose from a roster of teams and characters from the Slam Dunk series to engage in arcade-style basketball matches. The game retains the anime’s humor and dynamic energy, blending realistic basketball mechanics with exaggerated, anime-inspired moves.

items.label: Galaga (Namco)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Atari 7800, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, and modern platforms like Xbox and PC.
items.desc: Players control a starfighter and must defend against waves of enemy formations while avoiding projectiles and attempting to rescue captured ships. The game is known for its challenging yet rewarding gameplay, innovative mechanics, and addictive nature.

items.label: Galaxian (Namco set 1)
items.platforms: Arcade, Atari 2600, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, and other retro platforms.
items.desc: Players control a starfighter tasked with defending Earth from waves of alien invaders. Unlike the stationary invaders in Space Invaders, enemies in Galaxian break from formation and dive toward the player, adding a new layer of challenge and excitement.

items.label: Gauntlet (rev 14)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Sega Master System, Atari ST, Commodore 64, and modern collections.
items.desc: Set in a labyrinth filled with dangerous creatures and traps, players choose one of four heroes—Warrior, Valkyrie, Wizard, or Elf—and work together to survive waves of enemies, collect treasure, and find the exit to the next level. Each hero has unique strengths and weaknesses, encouraging teamwork and strategic play.

items.label: GAUNTLET II
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Sega Master System, Commodore 64, Amiga, Atari ST, and modern platforms.
items.desc: In Gauntlet II, players once again delve into labyrinthine dungeons filled with treasure, traps, and hordes of enemies. The game retains the four iconic character classes—Warrior, Valkyrie, Wizard, and Elf—while introducing new dungeon layouts, enemy types, and mechanics for a richer experience.

items.label: Ghosts'n Goblins (World? set 1)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Sega Genesis, and modern collections.
items.desc: Players control Sir Arthur, a knight on a quest to rescue Princess Prin-Prin, who has been kidnapped by the demon Astaroth. Arthur must traverse six perilous stages filled with ghouls, zombies, demons, and other supernatural creatures to defeat the forces of evil and save the princess.

items.label: Golden Axe (set 1, World, FD1094 317-0110)
items.platforms: Arcade, Sega Genesis, Sega Master System, Amiga, Commodore 64, PC, and modern platforms.
items.desc: Players embark on a quest to defeat the evil tyrant Death Adder, who has captured the king and queen and taken control of the Golden Axe, a symbol of peace in the land. Players can choose from three heroes, each with unique abilities and attacks, as they battle through waves of enemies in varied, fantastical settings.

items.label: Golden Axe II (Mega Play) (Rev B)
items.released: 1991 (Mega Drive); Mega Play Arcade version released later
items.desc: Set in a high-fantasy world, Golden Axe II continues the saga of the three legendary warriors—Ax Battler, Tyris Flare, and Gilius Thunderhead. The heroes face a new enemy, Dark Guld, who has risen to power and threatens the land with his dark magic. The game builds on its predecessor with improved mechanics, new levels, and expanded combat options.

items.label: Gradius (Japan, ROM version)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, MSX, Commodore 64, PC Engine, and modern collections.
items.desc: Set in the fictional universe of Gradius, players control the Vic Viper, a powerful starfighter tasked with defending the planet from the invading Bacterion forces. The game is known for its innovative power-up system, intense action, and iconic level designs, including the memorable “moai” stage.

items.label: Gradius III (Asia)
items.platforms: Arcade, Super Nintendo (SNES), PC Engine, and modern platforms.
items.desc: Set in a distant galaxy, Gradius III tasks players with piloting the Vic Viper to battle the Bacterion forces once again. The game features improved graphics, a more complex power-up system, and an increased level of difficulty compared to its predecessors.

items.label: Green Beret (Rush’n Attack in North America)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, MSX, Amstrad CPC, and modern collections.
items.desc: Players control a lone Green Beret soldier infiltrating an enemy base to rescue prisoners of war. Armed with a knife as the default weapon, players must navigate through enemy-infested levels, picking up and utilizing additional weapons such as flamethrowers, grenades, and rocket launchers.

items.label: Ikari Warriors (US)
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, Commodore 64, Amiga, Atari ST, and more.
items.desc: Players assume the roles of two commandos, Ralf and Clark, on a mission to infiltrate enemy territory and save a captured general. Armed with machine guns and grenades, they battle through waves of enemies, tanks, and fortifications across jungle and battlefield settings.

items.label: Ironman Ivan Stewart's Super Off-Road
items.platforms: Arcade, NES, SNES, Sega Genesis, Amiga, Commodore 64, and modern collections.
items.desc: Players race trucks on dirt tracks filled with hazards, sharp turns, and jumps. The goal is to outpace opponents, collect cash bonuses, and upgrade your vehicle to improve performance. The game supports up to three players simultaneously, adding a chaotic and competitive edge to the racing action.

items.label: Marvel Super Heroes (Euro 951024)
items.platforms: Arcade (CPS-2 hardware), PlayStation, Sega Saturn, later ported to modern systems in collections.
items.desc: Inspired by the Infinity Gauntlet storyline from Marvel Comics, Marvel Super Heroes pits iconic heroes and villains against each other in a battle for control of the powerful Infinity Stones. Each stone grants unique abilities that players can use strategically during fights, adding a layer of depth to the gameplay.

items.label: Marvel Vs. Capcom: Clash of Super Heroes (Euro 980123)
items.platforms: Arcade (CPS-2 hardware), PlayStation, Dreamcast, later ported to modern systems in collections.
items.desc: The game features a roster of iconic characters from both the Marvel Universe and Capcom’s gaming franchises. Players choose two characters to form a team and engage in tag-team battles against their opponents. The game emphasizes dynamic combat, colorful visuals, and chaotic team-based mechanics.

items.label: Metal Slug 3 (NGM-2560)
items.platforms: Neo Geo (arcade and home console), PlayStation 2, Xbox, PC, and modern platforms.
items.desc: Players take on the role of members of the Peregrine Falcon Squad, battling against General Morden’s forces and a mysterious alien threat. The game is known for its dynamic levels, branching paths, and an arsenal of quirky vehicles, all delivered with the series’ trademark over-the-top humor and vibrant 2D visuals.

items.label: Mortal Kombat 4 (version 3.0)
items.desc: Mortal Kombat is a revolutionary fighting game series featuring brutal combat mechanics and iconic fatalities.

The objective is to collect all bombs on each screen, with bonus points awarded for collecting bombs in a specific order. The game is known for its fast-paced gameplay, vibrant graphics, and catchy music.
